metadata.title: CVE-2017-11720 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
There is a division-by-zero vulnerability in LAME 3.99.5, caused by amalformed input file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11720` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lame - 3.99.5+repack1-3ubuntu1+esm2
libmp3lame0 - 3.99.5+repack1-3ubuntu1+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: lame package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.99.5+repack1-3ubuntu1+esm2').
